channel.title: Looping gfx's

item.title: Looping gfx's
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

i did but how do i make a command change the Boolean to true?

i didn’t do it his way i did it my own way.

i declared it like this.

public boolean modglow = false;

and how i make command change it to true for that user?

Read full topic

item.title: Looping gfx's
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Uum, ok iv ben trying to fix this error

client.java:72: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable modglow
location: class client
                if (modglow == true) {//PMod Glow
                    ^
client.java:11328: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable modglow
location: class client
               modglow = true;
               ^

I haven’t been doing to good. any help?

I tried adding it as a int but…no.

edit*

ok i added modglow as a public Boolean or however you spell it and it dosint give errors but it wont work now…

Read full topic

item.title: Looping gfx's
item.dc:creator: @nibl nibl
item.description:
@nibl wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:3, topic:237954”][code]
private Timer glowTimer = new Timer(); // make this a field, if it’s a local variable then it will not be able to be accessed from outside the case

glowTimer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() {
public void run() {
stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
}
}, 0, 1000);
[/code] Seems like a good way to do it.
Invoke the timer’s cancel method to stop the glow.[/quote]Or you could put it in a way he could understand, and tell him to add a boolean to his process, but then again that would be half-assing it ;).

Read full topic

item.title: Looping gfx's
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[code]
private Timer glowTimer = new Timer(); // make this a field, if it’s a local variable then it will not be able to be accessed from outside the case

glowTimer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() {
public void run() {
stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
}
}, 0, 1000);
[/code] Seems like a good way to do it.
Invoke the timer’s cancel method to stop the glow.

Read full topic

item.title: Looping gfx's
item.dc:creator: @noob_pwner noob pwner
item.description:
@noob_pwner wrote:

i did mine like this:

[code]}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“modglow”) && playerRights >= 1)
{
modglow = true;
}

    else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("adminglow") && playerRights >= 2)
    {
           adglow = true;
    }

    else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("ownerglow") && playerRights >= 3)
    {
           ownerglow = true;
    }

    else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("modglowoff") && playerRights >= 1)
    {
           modglow = false;
    }

    else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("adminglowoff") && playerRights >= 2)
    {
           adglow = false;
    }

    else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("ownerglowoff") && playerRights >= 3)
    {
           ownerglow = false;
    }[/code]

then i set these:

if (adglow == true) {//Admin Glow stillgfx(197, absY, absX); } if (modglow == true) {//PMod Glow stillgfx(247, absY, absX); } if (ownerglow == true) {//Owner Glow stillgfx(332, absY, absX); }

Read full topic
